title: Wendy Williams receivin Hollywood Walk of Fame star after 'tough year'
text:
Things are looking up for Wendy (Picture: David Livingston/Getty)

Wendy Williams paid an emotional tribute to her son, thanking him for his support, while receiving her star on the Hollywood Walk Of Fame on Thursday.

The US talk show host has been on an emotional rollercoaster for the past year, following a stint in a sober house after battling addiction and divorcing her husband of 21 years Kevin Hunter after he had a child with another woman.

However, the 55-year-old used the landmark occasion to celebrate, addressing her past hardships but revealing that she is working to rebuild her life.

‘The elephant in the room is that I’ve been having a very, very tough year,’ Wendy told crowds as she was presented with her star by radio presenter Elvis Duran.

‘But slowly, but surely, I’m climbing out of the pit and this is one of those monumental days that makes me say, you know, if you don’t believe in yourself who will believe in you?

She continued: ‘Sometimes life is a very lonely path and you’ve got to make some hard decisions.’

A star is born (Picture: David Livingston/Getty)

Turning to her 18-year-old son, Kevin Hunter Jr., Wendy tearfully said: ‘There’s one person here that knows, you know, there’s no place like home, right?

Wendy Williams holds back tears as she begins her Walk of Fame speech and thanks her loyal, hard-working staff https://t.co/sR59WmZcaI pic.twitter.com/T3GBTCpz6L — Variety (@Variety) October 17, 2019

‘A little burning food in oven, time to run up to the grocery store, let’s go. Just mom. Thank you Kevin.’

In May, Wendy’s son was arrested after getting into a physical altercation with his father one month after divorce proceedings began.

The family members reportedly got into an argument over Kevin’s request for spousal support from Wendy in their divorce, with the father allegedly accusing Wendy of ‘brainwashing’ their son.

Police told TMZ that Kevin Jr was arrested for assault but Kevin Sr was not interested in taking legal action against him.
